poem:
**Shared Ownership**

Trapped in bricks, in this half-held dream,  
A paper's fraud leaves us grieving.  
Flames of distrust flicker unseen,  
As we wait, shadowed by a name,  
Kiziak's pen like a thief,  
In our hearth's hollowed belief.  
Shared not just in ownership, but in silent despair,  
As walls echo the sigh, "will hope repair?"

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
